name: The Endpoint URI must not include a fragment component (OAuth)
description:
The Redirection Endpoint is used by the Authorization Server for returning the Authorization Response (which contains the authorization credentials) to the client via the Resource Owner user-agent.

The endpoint URI MUST NOT include a fragment component.

The default Authorization Response baseUri (redirection endpoint) is /login/oauth2/code/*, which is defined in OAuth2LoginAuthenticationFilter.DEFAULT_FILTER_PROCESSES_URI.

A fragment identifier component is indicated by the presence of a number sign ("#") character and terminated by the end of the URI as : https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986#section-3.5

Redirect URI with # character breaks parsing
output:
Associated to each violation, the following information is provided:
- The number of violation occurrences
- Bookmarks for violation occurrences found in the source code
rationale: The endpoint URI MAY include an "application/x-www-form-urlencoded" formatted query component    which MUST be retained when adding additional query parameters. But, the endpoint URI MUST NOT include a fragment component.
remediation: If you would like to customize the Authorization Response baseUri, you should not include a fragment component.
alternativeName: Ensure not using fragment component in the Endpoint URI
